intro: Mascarenhasia tenuifolia, commonly known as the Mascarene fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas or on rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
